alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 10 at 2:51AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following county, Okanogan. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A round of slower moving thunderstorms and widely scattered rain showers are expected through Saturday afternoon. Heavy rain downpours could lead to flash flooding especially in steep terrain and near burn scars in the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
